meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a grammatical case expressing motion out of or away from.

meanings.sent2: She ran elatively from the scary noise in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The cat jumped elatively out of the box, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed elatively through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled elatively as the storm approached.

meanings.sent2: Her excitement was elative when she received the good news.
meanings.sent3: The elative joy on his face was contagious, spreading to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The elative colors of the sunset painted the sky in a breathtaking display.
meanings.sent5: The elative speed of the car left a trail of dust behind.

meanings.definition: A word or affix expressing motion out of or away from.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence, the elative indicated the direction of the action.
meanings.sent2: The elative in the phrase 'out of the tunnel' shows movement away from a place.
